edu.umaryland.igs.idea
Class MultipleChoiceParameter

java.lang.Object
  edu.umaryland.igs.idea.Parameter
      edu.umaryland.igs.idea.MultipleChoiceParameter
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
BooleanParameter
public class MultipleChoiceParameter
extends Parameter

MultipleChoiceParameter represents an IDEA parameter that allows the user to choose one of multiple options. This class overrides Parameter to provide an entry area with radio buttons. The buttons may be arranged either horizontally or vertically. If the buttons are laid out horizontally, the parameter name is displayed above the buttons; if the buttons are laid out vertically, the parameter name is not displayed. BooleanParameter is a convenience extension for parameters with only two possible values.

Written:

Copyright (C) 2009, Amy Egan and Joana C. Silva.

All rights reserved.

Author:
Amy Egan

Constructor Detail

MultipleChoiceParameter

public MultipleChoiceParameter(String n,
                               Object v,
                               ParameterExplanation e)
This constructor creates a MultipleChoiceParameter with horizontally arranged radio buttons labeled "Yes" and "No". It calls the superclass constructor.

Parameters:
n - the parameter name
v - the parameter value
e - the parameter explanation

MultipleChoiceParameter

public MultipleChoiceParameter(String n,
                               Object v,
                               ParameterExplanation e,
                               String[] cs)
This constructor creates a MultipleChoiceParameter with horizontally arranged radio buttons. The fourth and fifth parameters are used as the names of the options.

Parameters:
n - the parameter name
v - the parameter value
e - the parameter explanation
cs - the names of the choices (as shown to the user)

MultipleChoiceParameter

public MultipleChoiceParameter(String n,
                               Object v,
                               ParameterExplanation e,
                               String[] cs,
                               boolean vertical)
This constructor creates a MultipleChoiceParameter with the given name, value, explanation and choices cs. The vertical parameter controls whether the radio buttons are arranged vertically or horizontally.

Parameters:
n - the parameter name
v - the parameter value
e - the parameter explanation
cs - the names of the choices (as shown to the user)
vertical - whether to arrange the radio buttons vertically (true) or horizontally (false)

displayRows

public int displayRows()
This method overrides the method in Parameter to request two rows for a horizontally displayed parameter or one row per choice for a vertically displayed parameter.

Overrides:
displayRows in class Parameter
Returns:
the number of rows the entry area for this parameter should take up on the display

addActionListener

public void addActionListener(ActionListener l)
The addActionListener method allows listeners on a MultipleChoiceParameter to process events on its radio buttons.

Overrides:
addActionListener in class Parameter
Parameters:
l - the action listener to add

resetActionListeners

void resetActionListeners()
The resetActionListeners method removes all action listeners on this parameter. It is useful in loading configurations saved using older versions of IDEA. Action listeners in these saved configurations may perform outdated actions, so they should be removed.

Overrides:
resetActionListeners in class Parameter

setEnabled

public void setEnabled(boolean enabled)
The setEnabled overrides the method in class Parameter to disable the radio buttons.

Overrides:
setEnabled in class Parameter
Parameters:
enabled - whether the parameter should be enabled

setEnabled

public void setEnabled(int... choices)
This setEnabled method enables only those choices at the specified indices and disables all others.

entryArea

public JPanel entryArea(int minimumNameLength)
The entryArea method returns a GUI component that displays the name of the parameter and, if available, an explanation of its interpretation and allows the user to supply a value. This overrides the superclass method to display a set of radio buttons instead of a text field. Callers of this method supply a minimumNameLength parameter obtained from a ParameterSet containing this parameter.

Overrides:
entryArea in class Parameter
Parameters:
minimumNameLength - the text label length, based on the maximum length among names in the parameter set
Returns:
a JPanel component to add to the GUI

isEnabled

public boolean isEnabled()
The isEnabled method returns whether at least two choices are currently enabled.

Overrides:
isEnabled in class Parameter
Returns:
whether at least two choices are enabled

updateValue

public void updateValue(Object newValue)
The updateValue method is called whenever the parameter's value is changed for some reason other than user input. For example, changing the value of one parameter may automatically change the value of another parameter. This method extends the superclass method to select the appropriate radio button.

Overrides:
updateValue in class Parameter
Parameters:
newValue - the new value for this parameter

readObject

private void readObject(ObjectInputStream in)
                 throws IOException,
                        ClassNotFoundException
The readObject method has the exact signature required for Java serialization, although serialization is actually performed using the third-party XStream library. Parameters require custom serialization because the action and focus listeners which update their values based on user input to the GUI are not fields of the objects they listen on and thus are not automatically restored during deserialization, so they must be restored explicitly to ensure that parameter changes the user makes after loading a saved configuration are honored. Since the addActionListener method modifies the actionListeners field, a copy must be used here to avoid a ConcurrentModificationException. After adding the listeners to the GUI components using addActionListener, the actionListeners parameter is reset to the copy so it will not contain duplicates. NOTE: This method is identical for class Parameter and all its subclasses, but because it is required to be private, it has been copied into each subclass.

Parameters:
in - the input stream from which to read this parameter
Throws:
IOException - if an I/O error occurs during deserialization
ClassNotFoundException - if a class in the hierarchy of the deserialized parameter is unrecognized
